noGitHubCredentials.title: No GitHub Credentials
noGitHubCredentials.description: Do not set any credentials. Note that credentials are required to extract .lkml views and their lineage.

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description: User's Client ID. This user should have privileges to read all the metadata in Looker.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: URL to the Looker instance.

githubCredentials.title: GitHub Credentials
githubCredentials.description: Credentials to extract the .lkml files from a repository. This is required to get all the lineage and definitions.

repositoryOwner.title: Repository Owner
repositoryOwner.description: The owner (user or organization) of a GitHub repository. For example, in https://github.com/open-metadata/OpenMetadata, the owner is `open-metadata`.

repositoryName.title: Repository Name
repositoryName.description: The name of a GitHub repository. For example, in https://github.com/open-metadata/OpenMetadata, the name is `OpenMetadata`.

token.title: API Token
token.description: Token to use the API. This is required for private repositories and to ensure we don't hit API limits.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to connect to Metabase. This user should have privileges to read all the metadata in Metabase.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and Port of the Metabase instance.

authorityURI.title: Authority URI
authorityURI.description: Authority URI for the PowerBI service.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Dashboard URL for PowerBI service.

pagination_entity_per_page.title: Pagination Entity Per Page
pagination_entity_per_page.description: Entity Limit set here will be used to paginate the PowerBi APIs

useAdminApis.title: Use PowerBI Admin APIs
useAdminApis.description: Fetch the PowerBI metadata using admin APIs

username.title: Username
username.description: Username for Redash

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: URL for the Redash instance

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: API key of the redash instance to access.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: URL for the superset instance.

connection.title: Superset Connection
connection.description: Choose between API or database connection fetch metadata from superset.

apiProvider.title: Provider
apiProvider.description: Authentication provider for the Superset service. For basic user/password authentication, the default value `db` can be used. This parameter is used internally to connect to Superset's REST API.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Authentication provider for the Superset service. For basic user/password authentication, the default value `db` can be used. This parameter is used internally to connect to Superset's REST API.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username for Superset.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Tableau Server.

authType.title: Authentication type for Tableau
authType.description: Types of methods used to authenticate to the tableau instance

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to access the service.

verifySSL.description: Client SSL verification. Make sure to configure the SSLConfig if enabled.

oneOf.title: ValidateSSLClientConfig
oneOf.description: OpenMetadata Client configured to validate SSL certificates.

certificatePath.description: CA certificate path. E.g., /path/to/public.cert. Will be used if Verify SSL is set to `validate`.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: URL for the mode instance.

accessTokenPassword.title: Access Token Password
accessTokenPassword.description: Access Token Password for Mode Dashboard

oneOf.title: CustomDashboardConnection
oneOf.description: Custom Dashboard Service connection to build a source that is not supported by OpenMetadata yet.

sourcePythonClass.title: Source Python Class Name
sourcePythonClass.description: Source Python Class Name to instantiated by the ingestion workflow

accessToken.title: Access Token
accessToken.description: Access token to connect to to DOMO

apiHost.title: API Host
apiHost.description: API Host to connect to DOMO instance

identityType.title: Identity Type
identityType.description: The authentication method that the user uses to sign in.

namespace.description: The Amazon QuickSight namespace that contains the dashboard IDs in this request ( To be provided when identityType is `ANONYMOUS` )

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: BigQuery APIs URL.

GCSCredentialsPath.title: GCS Credentials Path
GCSCredentialsPath.description: Pass the path of file containing the GCS credentials info

gcsConfig.title: GCS Credentials Configuration
gcsConfig.description: We support two ways of authenticating to GCS i.e via GCS Credentials Values or GCS Credentials Path

oneOf.title: GCS Credentials Values
oneOf.description: Pass the raw credential values provided by GCS

taxonomyProjectID.title: Taxonomy Project IDs
taxonomyProjectID.description: Project IDs used to fetch policy tags

taxonomyLocation.title: Taxonomy Location
taxonomyLocation.description: Taxonomy location used to fetch policy tags

usageLocation.title: Usage Location
usageLocation.description: Location used to query INFORMATION_SCHEMA.JOBS_BY_PROJECT to fetch usage data. You can pass multi-regions, such as `us` or `eu`, or you specific region. Australia and Asia multi-regions are not yet in GA.

supportsQueryComment.title: Supports Query Comment
supportsQueryComment.description: For Database Services using SQLAlchemy, True to enable running a comment for all queries run from OpenMetadata.

databaseName.title: Database Name
databaseName.description: Optional name to give to the database in OpenMetadata. If left blank, we will use default as the database name.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to connect to AzureSQL. This user should have privileges to read the metadata.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and port of the AzureSQL service.

database.title: Database
database.description: Database of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single database. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the databases.

supportsDatabase.title: Supports Database
supportsDatabase.description: The source service supports the database concept in its hierarchy

username.title: Username

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and port of the Clickhouse service.

databaseSchema.title: Database Schema
databaseSchema.description: Database Schema of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single schema. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the schemas.

keyfile.title: Key File Path
keyfile.description: Path to key file for establishing secure connection

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and port of the Databricks service.

token.title: Token
token.description: Generated Token to connect to Databricks.

catalog.title: Catalog
catalog.description: Catalog of the data source(Example: hive_metastore). This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single catalog. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the catalog.

databaseSchema.title: Database Schema
databaseSchema.description: Database Schema of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single schema. When left blank, OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the schemas.

connectionTimeout.title: Connection Timeout
connectionTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait for a successful connection to the data source. If the connection attempt takes longer than this timeout period, an error will be returned.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to connect to DB2. This user should have privileges to read all the metadata in DB2.

hostPort.title: Host and Port
hostPort.description: Host and port of the DB2 service.

metastoreHostPort.title: Hive Metastore Service
metastoreHostPort.description: Thrift connection to the metastore service. E.g., localhost:9083

metastoreDb.title: Hive Metastore Database
metastoreDb.description: JDBC connection to the metastore database. E.g., jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/demo_hive

username.title: Connection UserName
username.description: Username to use against metastore database. The value will be mapped as spark.hadoop.javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName sparks property.

password.title: Connection Password
password.description: Password to use against metastore database. The value will be mapped as spark.hadoop.javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword sparks property.

driverName.title: Connection Driver Name
driverName.description: Driver class name for JDBC metastore. The value will be mapped as spark.hadoop.javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName sparks property. E.g., org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver

jdbcDriverClassPath.title: JDBC Driver Class Path
jdbcDriverClassPath.description: Class path to JDBC driver required for JDBC connection. The value will be mapped as sparks.driver.extraClassPath sparks property.

metastoreFilePath.title: Hive Metastore File Path
metastoreFilePath.description: Local path for the local file with metastore data. E.g., /tmp/metastore.db

metastoreConnection.title: Hive Metastore Connection
metastoreConnection.description: Hive metastore service, local file path or metastore db.

databaseName.description: Optional name to give to the database in OpenMetadata. If left blank, we will use default as the database name.

connectionArguments.title: Connection Arguments
connectionArguments.description: Key-Value pairs that will be used to add configs to the SparkSession.

instantClientDirectory.description: This directory will be used to set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH env variable. It is required if you need to enable thick connection mode. By default, we bring instant client 19 and point to /instantclient.
